pages.text: Almost everything in the world in TFC is useful to us. Use your $(item)knife$() to destroy some tall grass, and get some Straw. Spend some time gathering a stack or two. You'll want a lot of it!
Straw can be crafted into thatch, your most basic construction block. Don't build your whole house out of it, though, as predators can walk right through it!

By making an axe out of loose rocks and sticks, we've removed the need to punch a tree. Go ahead and chop down a tree, starting at the base. It might take a bit longer than you're used to, but in the end the whole tree will fall down!$(br2) The next thing we'll want to create is a $(item)shovel$().
Let's make it a little easier to get dirt. Craft a stone shovel to start moving earth properly. For a complete knapping recipe guide, see the $(l:reference/rock_knapping)reference section.$()

You'll also want to look for $(item)clay dirt$(). $(l:getting_started/pottery)Clay$() spawns in areas with moderate to heavy rainfall, and you'll want your shovel to dig it up.$(br2)Since the world is covered in grass, it's easiest to look for $(thing)clay indicator plants$(). At the temperature of where you spawn, the clay indicator is the $(item)Athyrium Fern$().
The Athyrium Fern spawns in the temperate region on top of Clay Dirt.
pages.name: Athyrium Fern

pages.text: The following is a list of $(thing)clay indicator plants$():$(br2)- Athyrium Fern$(br)- Canna Lily$(br)- Goldenrod$(br)- Pampas Grass$(br)- Russian Sage$(br)- Rose$(br)- Water Canna$(br2)$(item)Note: Flowers bloom only at certain times of year, so searching for the plant you're looking for may be frustrating in the winter.
